meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Here's What Happens To Google Employees When They Die

div.div: “This might sound ridiculous,” Bock said recently during a conversation on the ever-evolving benefits at the company, “But we’ve announced death benefits at Google.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OMnTDz&via=Digg&text=Here's What Happens To Google Employees When They Die

div.a: BAM! A Comic Book Store That Looks Like A Comic Book

div.div: One way physical bookstores can compete with online retailers is to be more fun. And what is more fun than a comic book store that looks like a bunch of comics? Probably nothing.

div.a: RT “@BookRiot: BAM! This comic book store looks like a comic book! … cc: @digg

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ORo2WT&via=Digg&text=BAM! A Comic Book Store That Looks Like A Comic Book

div.a: Agency Redesigns Wikipedia To Be Less Ugly

div.div: A design agency has done a sleek mockup of what a more beautiful Wikipedia would look like.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/N02w5V&via=Digg&text=Agency Redesigns Wikipedia To Be Less Ugly

div.a: Video Shows Cats Kill More Animals Than Thought

div.div: That mouse carcass Kitty presents you with is just the tip of a very bloody iceberg. When researchers attached kittycams to house cats, they found a secret world of slaughter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O1PP7P&via=Digg&text=Video Shows Cats Kill More Animals Than Thought

div.div: PLAY THE BODY, NOT THE BALL

div.a: Olympic Scrotum Punching -- French Basketball Player Goes NUTS on Spain

div.div: Don't kid yourself -- basketball is absolutely a contact sport.

div.a: There are other ways to show your desire to win other than punching another man in the testicles.

div.a: How Secret Foreign Money Could Infiltrate U.S. Elections

div.div: Foreign money and American elections are like fire and water, orange juice and toothpaste, Yankees fans and Red Sox fans: The two don't mix.

div.div: Here's where all your missing socks went.

div.a: Video Shows Helicopters, Machine Guns Used In Raid On Kim Dotcom's Mansion

div.div: A New Zealand news outlet has released video footage of the controversial police raid of Megaupload founder Kim Dotcom.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5eydW&via=Digg&text=Video Shows Helicopters, Machine Guns Used In Raid On Kim Dotcom's Mansion

div.a: How A Lying 'Social Engineer' Hacked Wal-Mart

div.div: The social engineering hackathon is an old-fashioned display of con artistry. With nothing more than a phone line and a really good story, a hacker can pry secrets loose from America's biggest and most guarded corporations.

div.a: "There is no patch for Human" How one #Defcon Hacker Hacked Walmart
Father Of Video Games Explains Multi-Purpose Consoles... In 1973

div.div: Ralph Baer, the inventor of home video games, envisioned consoles would be used for much than just playing games and would supply on-demand video and other services to users all the way back in 1973.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nbxeal&via=Digg&text=Father Of Video Games Explains Multi-Purpose Consoles... In 1973

div.a: HBR: Olympics' 'Greatest Feat' Is An 'Unpaid, Highly Engaged Workforce'

div.div: They are all over the Games. They greet you at the airport. They direct you from the trains... There are 70,000 of them, constituting nearly half of the Olympic workforce, Britain's biggest peacetime mobilization of people since the Second World War. They make this extraordinary event possible. They are the volunteers... and they are everywhere.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TfMzaJ&via=Digg&text=HBR: Olympics' 'Greatest Feat' Is An 'Unpaid, Highly Engaged Workforce'

div.a: U.S. Posts Hottest July On Record

div.div: The average temperature for the contiguous U.S. during July was 77.6°F, 3.3°F above the 20th century average, marking the hottest July and the hottest month on record for the nation.

div.a: Who Cries The Most At The Olympics?

div.div: The 2012 Olympic Games in London have been emotional for the athletes and the athletes' families, whether you are Michael Phelps or Michael Phelps' mother. Here is a look at some of the best emotions from the Olympics thus far.

div.a: I'm not crying... it's just been raining on my face (courtesy of @michelmcbride)

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OKucaI&via=Digg&text=Who Cries The Most At The Olympics?

div.a: Potential Romney VP Pick Owns 'Haunted Hotel'

div.div: A prospective vice presidential candidate owns a haunted hotel? Get me a reservation.

div.div: “Ever since I was a kid, I've been telling people that I want to be a robot.”

div.a: This Unopened 1st-Gen iPhone Can Be Yours For Just $10,000

div.div: Are you a hardcore Apple geek? Do you have either a ton of disposable income or a willingness to live on the street with nothing but a thin trash bag as protection against the elements? If so, we have the Ebay listing of your dreams right here.
